column4: It's really a shame that a PIII with 1000MHz and 256MB RAM doesn't do for normal office work under Linux, speed-wise.

Not for somebody who is used to Windows XP and MS Office. I didn't want to believe, but then I tried -- XP is up in about 20 seconds, Word takes less than 5. Ubuntu needs circa 1:30, then OpenOffice another minute.
now i could tell you all that stuff about windows preloading office, but i won't ;)
i admit that gnome on anything but recent hardware (< 3 years) feels slow
Well, that's all fine. But even WITH preloading office, Windows takes 20 seconds to boot on this machine, as opposed to Ubuntu - which does not preload OpenOffice and needs one and a half minute
GNOME itself actually is as fast as I could wish. The problem is booting time and office suite startup time. Everything else is fine.
there's a gnome-applet for preloading ooo - maybe that'll help a bit
I just tried that. It isn't a preloader, just a starter.
now the question is who's rapha.. but that's certainly ot ;)
rapha is more or less a regular visitor in here
assume i know nothing about this channel. which is true :)
